STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 20, 2023
Courtney LYNN-SMITH Atkins
CLARE COUNTY DHHS
725 RICHARD DR,
HARRISON, MI, 48625-9289
RE: License#: CP180201067
Dear Courtney LYNN-SMITH Atkins:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 9/19/2023 . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5060.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
FOM 722-06B – Family Team Meetings
The DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, is used to capture family demographics,
FTM logistical information, needs, strengths, action steps, safety concerns and the safety
plan, and any recommendations made for the family during the FTM. The DHS-1105,
Family Team Meeting Report, must be completed for every FTM.
One of the three foster child records reviewed did not contain the required information for
documentation of FTM's that were completed as required. This record indicated FTM's
were completed 2/1/23 and 4/19/23, and no 1105 or 901 documents were located as
required. The time period 5/4/-7/31/23 also did not document that an FTM had been
completed for that time period as required. This is a repeat noncompliance from the
interim evaluation completed 12/8/2022.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• None
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD

There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency submitted a corrective action plan for the interim evaluation completed
12/8/2022. Areas identified in noncompliance were Rule 324(4)(c) and FOM 722-
06 B. The only area identified in noncompliance as a part of this renewal review
was FOM 722-06 B.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment provided a review of the corrective action
plan for the interim evaluation completed 12/8/2022 and an assessment of the key
performance indicators.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff comments were positive,
and no concerns were noted.
The analyst caregivers and youth interviews were generally positive and indicated
appropriate support and services are being provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is well maintained, and record storage is consistent with compliance
for licensing rules.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The analyst identified 4 safety alerts all of which have been resolved. One safety
alert involved a foster family and the other 3 safety alerts involved relative caregivers.
All of the safety alerts have been resolved with appropriate documentation to confirm
compliance.
Concern 1 - Home is on a lake and the foster family did not have door alarms or a
safety device.
Resolution - Door alarms and a safety device were obtained, and picture
documentation confirmed resolution.
Concern 2 - Home has a pool and they did not have door alarms or a safety device.

Resolution - Door alarms were obtained and installed 5/16/23 and the safety device
was obtained 5/26/23. Picture documentation was received to confirm compliance.
Concern 3 - Home did not have plug covers on electrical outlets and there are young
children in the home.
Resolution - Plug covers were obtained and installed 6/7/2023. Picture
documentation was received to confirm compliance.
Concern 4 - Home is on a lake and they did not have door alarms and a safety
device.
Resolution - Safety device was obtained and door alarms were installed 6/29/2023.
Picture documentation was received to confirm compliance.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
09/20/2023

Mark Hunter Date
